gurmukhi: lKI dMq bwlw ]mno rwg mwlw ]rMgI rMg KylM ]mno nwgR bylM ]264]
transliteration: Lakhikant Baalaa|| Mano Raag Maalaa|| Raniran Khelan|| Mano Naagre Belan||264||
translation: The teeth the girl were like the garland of flowers; she was absorbed in frolic like the creeper clinging to the tree.264.

gurmukhi: qbY d`q rwXM ]lKy qws gwXM ]gurU qws kInw ]mhw mMqR BInw ]265]
transliteration: Tabai Datt Raayan|| Lakhe Taas Gadyan|| Guroo Taas Keedaa|| Mahaa Mantra Bheenaa||265||
translation: Then Dutt, seeing her, eulogized her and accepting her as his Guru, he was absorbed in his great mantra.265.

gurmukhi: gurU qws jwnXo ]iemM mMqR TwnXo ]dsM dÍY inDwnM ]gurU d`q jwnM ]266]
transliteration: Guroo Taas Jaanyo|| Iman Mantra Thaanyo|| Dasan Dvai Nidhaanan|| Guroo Datt Jaanan||266||
translation: He accepted her as his Guru and in this way, adopted the mantra; in this way, Dutt adopted his twelfth Guru.266.

gurmukhi: liK Cib bwlI ]Aiq duiq vwlI ]AiqBuq rUpM ]jxu buD kUpM ]267]
transliteration: Lakh(i) Chhab(i) Baalee|| At(i) Dout(i) Vaalee|| Atibhout Roopan|| Jan(u) Budh Koopan||267||
translation: The beauty of that girl was unique and marvelous; she appeared to be a store of intellect; the sage saw her.267.

gurmukhi: iPr iPr pyKw ]bhu ibD lyKw ]qn mn jwnw ]gun gn mwnw ]268]
transliteration: Phir Phir Pekhaa|| Bahu Bidh Lekhaa|| Tan Man Jaanaa|| Goun Gad Maanaa||268||
translation: Then he saw her again and again in various ways and accepted her quality in his mind and body.268.

gurmukhi: iqh gur kInw ]Aiq jsu lInw ]Ag qb cwlw ]jnu muin jÍwlw ]269]
transliteration: Tih Gur Keedaa|| At(i) Jas(u) Linaa|| Ag Tab Chalaa|| Jan(u) Mounndi) Jvaalaa||269||
translation: After adopting he as his Guru, he offered her approbation and then moved further like the flame of fire.269.

gurmukhi: ieiq duAwds gurU smwpqM lVkI gufI KylqI ]12]
transliteration: It(i) Duaadas Guroo Samaaptan Ladki Gudi Khelatee||12||
translation: End of the description of the adoption of a girl playing with her doll as his twelfth Guru.
Now begins the description of an Orderly as the Thirteenth Guru

gurmukhi: qb d`q dyv mhwn ]ds cwr cwr inDwn ]AiqBuq au`qm gwq ]hir nwm lyq pRBwq ]270]
transliteration: Tab Datt Dev Mahaan|| Das Chaar Chaar Nidhaan|| Atibhout Outtam Gadt|| Har(i) Naam Let Prabhaat||270||
translation: Then the great Dutt, who was a treasure in eighteen sciences and had a fine physique, used to remember the Name of the Lord at day-dawn.270.

gurmukhi: AklMk au`jl AMg ]liK lwj gMg qrMg ]AnBY ABUq srUp ]liK joq lwjq BUp ]271]
transliteration: Akalank Ujjal An|| Lakh(i) Laaj Gadg Taran|| Anbhai Abhoot Daroop|| Lakh(i) Jot Laajat Bhoop||271||
translation: Seeing his bright and blemishless limbs, the waves of Ganges felt shy; looking at his marvelous figure, the kings became shyful.271.

gurmukhi: Aivlok suBiRq eyk ]gun m`iD jws Anyk ]AD rwq TwF duAwr ]bhu brK myG Puhwr ]272]
transliteration: Avilok Soubhrit Ek|| Goun Maddh(i) Jaas Anek|| Adh Raat Thaadh Duaar|| Bahu Barakh Megh Phuhaar||272||
translation: He saw an orderly, who had many qualities, even at midnight, he was standing at the gate and in this way, during the rainfall, he stood firmly without caring for the rain.272.
